page.title: 18SALTBURN GRANGE FARM.
page.content: The farm, situated on Saltburn Lane, consists of 216 acres of land used to grow wheat, barley, oil seed rape and beef cattle. The land (classed as grade 3 - average) has been farmed for over 600 years. Many of the buildings are 200 years old. The coastal winds and salty sea air affect the growth of crops and is the farms main problem. Mr.Hornsby and family run the farm and employ a person in the summer to help with harvesting. It is hard work based on daily routines. Feeding animals, servicing machinery, cutting hay and working in the fields makes up a typical days work in June. The farm has 55 beef cattle (34 outside, 21 inside), 11 hens, 1 cockeral, 5 chicks, 5 ducks, 2 ducklings, 2 dogs and 3 cats. Mr.Hornsby is the chairman of the local NUF and his family have been tenant farmers for 3 generations.
